alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:41AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers expected above 1500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to an inch possible. Cold temperatures below 32 degrees could cause black ice to form on wet roads. * WHERE...Central Douglas County including the towns of Azalea, Glendale, Tiller, and portions of Highway 42 near Camas Valley, Interstate 5 south of Canyonville, and portions of the Tiller- Trail Highway. Jackson County including Highway 62 from Shady Cove to Union Creek, the Applegate Valley area from Jacksonville to near Applegate and Provolt, Highway 140 east of White City, higher portions of Interstate 5 from Grants Pass to Blackwell Hill, and all roads from south and east Medford southeast to the Talent and Ashland areas. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel this morning could be difficult due to slick, snow or ice covered roads. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
